allow:
Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Add AI transparency and development documentation

Comprehensive transparency documentation for AI-assisted development:

- AI_DEVELOPMENT_LOG.md: Complete session log documenting AI''s role
  - Development timeline and phases
  - Human vs AI decision-making
  - Prompts and interactions
  - Reproducibility instructions
  - Ethical considerations

- CITATION.cff: Academic citation file
  - Credits both human and AI contributions
  - Structured metadata for research use

- README.md: Added AI transparency section
  - Links to detailed documentation
  - Clear attribution of AI role
  - Development methodology summary

Transparency Features:
- Session timeline (2 hours, Oct 20 2025)
- Model identification (Claude Sonnet 4.5)
- Code attribution breakdown (95% AI-generated)
- Decision-making process documented
- Reproducibility instructions included
- Ethical considerations addressed

This ensures scientific integrity and allows others to:
1. Understand how AI was used
2. Reproduce the development process
3. Properly cite the project
4. Evaluate AI contribution vs human expertise

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")

Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Reorganize project structure for better navigation

Moved all documentation to organized docs/ folder:

Structure Changes:
- docs/ - All documentation now in one place
  - Core guides (ARCHITECTURE, GETTING_STARTED, etc.)
  - reference/ - Sample data and examples
  - results/ - Test results and validations
- Root now clean: README, CITATION, requirements, code folders only

Improvements:
- Added docs/README.md as documentation index
- Updated all internal links in README
- Visual project tree in main README
- Quick links to key documents
- Clearer separation: docs vs code vs data

Benefits:
- Easier navigation for new users
- Logical grouping of related files
- Professional project structure
- Better GitHub browsing experience
- Clearer distinction between reference/results

Root directory now has only 9 items (was 17):
âœ… README.md, CITATION.cff, requirements.txt
âœ… .claude/, docs/, data/, scripts/, src/, tests/

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")
Bash(pip3 install -q geopandas shapely pyproj pandas numpy)

Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Add Spizocorys fringillaris (Botha''s Lark) assessment

Complete IUCN Red List assessment for Botha''s Lark using automated pipeline:

Assessment Results:
- Species: Spizocorys fringillaris (Botha''s Lark)
- Preliminary Category: ENDANGERED (EN)
- Criterion: B2 (Area of Occupancy)
- EOO: 37,609.72 kmÂ² (above threatened thresholds)
- AOO: 240 kmÂ² (below EN threshold of 500 kmÂ²)
- Occupied grid cells: 60

Data Collected:
- Taxonomic data: Resolved from GBIF (99% confidence)
  - Family Alaudidae, Order Passeriformes
  - 9 common names across languages
  - Authority: (Sundevall, 1850)

- Occurrence data: 130 unique locations from GBIF
  - 264 total records (1909-2024)
  - Endemic to South Africa only
  - Primary region: Mpumalanga province
  - High coordinate quality (avg 4.72 decimal places)

- Geographic metrics: Calculated using GeoPandas
  - ESRI:54009 equal-area projection
  - 2Ã—2 km IUCN standard grid for AOO
  - Minimum convex polygon for EOO

Pipeline Execution:
- Phase 1: Taxonomy + Occurrence agents (parallel)
- Phase 2: Geographic agent (EOO/AOO calculations)
- All three output JSON files generated
- Total processing time: ~2 minutes

Conservation Implications:
- Highly range-restricted species (240 kmÂ² AOO)
- Vulnerable to habitat loss and localized threats
- Aligns with official IUCN Red List status (EN)

Note: This is a preliminary assessment based on geographic
range only. Full assessment requires population trends,
threats, and habitat analysis (Phases 3-5).

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")
